{{% blocks/products/pf/agp/feature-section-row title="About RM4SCC Symbology" %}}

<div class="container" style="margin-bottom: 25px;">
<div class="row justify-content-center"style="align-items: center;">
<div class="col-md-6 tc">
<img styles="max-width: 400px;max-height: 400px;" src="data:image/png;base64,"></img>
</div>
<div class="col-md-6" style="font-size: 1rem;">
<p>
RM4SCC (Royal Mail 4-State Customer Code) is a barcode type developed by the Royal Mail, the postal service provider in the United Kingdom. It is specifically designed to optimize mail sorting and delivery processes within the country. RM4SCC provides a robust and efficient method of encoding postal address information, allowing for accurate and automated mail sorting. It is widely used to send letters, postcards, and other mail items through the Royal Mail system.
</p>
</div></div></div>

{{% /blocks/products/pf/agp/feature-section-row %}}

{{% blocks/products/pf/agp/feature-section-row title="RM4SCC Features" %}}
<ul><li><b>4-State Structure:</b> RM4SCC barcodes are designed based on a 4-state barcode structure and comprise full bars, ascenders, trackers, and descenders. These states represent different characters and encode alphanumeric characters of postal addresses.</li><li><b>Compact Size:</b> RM4SCC is designed to be compact, making it suitable for printing on various mail items, such as envelopes and labels.</li><li><b>Human-Readable Text:</b> RM4SCC barcodes can include human-readable text representation, enabling easy manual entry and visual verification of the encoded information.</li></ul><h4>Applications</h4><ul><li><b>Mail Sorting:</b> The primary application of RM4SCC is the mail sorting process. The use of this barcode standard allows postal service providers, such as the Royal Mail, to automate the sorting of mail items based on the encoded address information, thus improving efficiency and reducing errors.</li><li><b>Postal Services:</b> RM4SCC is widely used for various postal services, including letter post, postcards, and business mail. It enables accurate processing, sorting, and delivery of mail items across the United Kingdom.</li><li><b>Direct Mail Marketing:</b> RM4SCC can be utilized in direct mail marketing campaigns. By incorporating such barcodes on promotional materials, businesses can take advantage of automated sorting processes, ensuring efficient delivery and targeting specific recipients.</li></ul><p>The 4-state structure and compact size of RM4SCC make it an efficient solution for encoding postal address information. Its widespread use within the Royal Mail system ensures accurate mail sorting and delivery, enhancing the overall efficiency of postal services in the United Kingdom.</p>
